# Copyright (c) 2015 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
# All rights reserved.
#
# April 2015,     R.A. Winters <riwinter@cisco.com>


# XxX.... or
# Xx<desc>X....
#
# desc is the string to label the match in the table
# x is literal and x is one of:
#
# A - address (ipv4 or ipv6)
# I - interface name
# F - floating point number
# H - hex number
# M - mac address
# N - number
# R - newline requires
# P - prefix address (ipv4 or ipv6)
# p - parenthesis - match value inside parens
# S - non-space
# T - time (00:0:00)
# W - word
#
# or XXX<regex>XXX... or
# or XXX<regex><desc>XXX...
#
# regex is a regular expression
# desc is the string to label the match in the table

OS: NXOS

CMD: SHOW_INTERFACE
SHOWCMD: show interface | no-more
PREFIX: intf

ACTUAL:

# show interface eth1/34
Ethernet1/34 is up
admin state is up, Dedicated Interface
  Hardware: 1000/10000 Ethernet, address: fc5b.394f.65c1 (bia fc5b.394f.65c1)
  Description: connection to UCS qa4 Intel 4x10G adapter port 2 - eth3
  MTU 9216 bytes, BW 10000000 Kbit, DLY 10 usec
  reliability 255/255, txload 1/255, rxload 1/255
  Encapsulation ARPA, medium is broadcast
  Port mode is trunk
  full-duplex, 10 Gb/s, media type is 10G
  Beacon is turned off
  Auto-Negotiation is turned on
  Input flow-control is off, output flow-control is off
  Auto-mdix is turned off
  Rate mode is dedicated
  Switchport monitor is off
  EtherType is 0x8100
  EEE (efficient-ethernet) : n/a
  Last link flapped 5week(s) 5day(s)
  Last clearing of "show interface" counters 00:13:57
  0 interface resets
  30 seconds input rate 48 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec
  30 seconds output rate 1720 bits/sec, 2 packets/sec
  Load-Interval #2: 5 minute (300 seconds)
    input rate 48 bps, 0 pps; output rate 1.70 Kbps, 2 pps
  RX
    5954 unicast packets  28 multicast packets  0 broadcast packets
    5982 input packets  32660602 bytes
    3900 jumbo packets  0 storm suppression packets
    0 runts  0 giants  0 CRC  0 no buffer
    0 input error  0 short frame  0 overrun   0 underrun  0 ignored
    0 watchdog  0 bad etype drop  0 bad proto drop  0 if down drop
    0 input with dribble  0 input discard
    0 Rx pause
  TX
    5980 unicast packets  2528 multicast packets  1 broadcast packets
    8509 output packets  32890534 bytes
    3900 jumbo packets
    0 output error  0 collision  0 deferred  0 late collision
    0 lost carrier  0 no carrier  0 babble  0 output discard
    0 Tx pause


MARKUP:

# show interface eth1/34
XI<name>XEthernet1/34 is XW<state>Xup
admin state is up, Dedicated Interface
  Hardware: XNX1000/XNX10000 Ethernet, address: XM<mac>Xfc5b.394f.65c1 (bia XM<bia>Xfc5b.394f.65c1)
  Description: connection to UCS qa4 Intel 4x10G adapter port 2 - eth3
  MTU XN<mtu>X9216 bytes, BW XN<bw>X10000000 XW<speed>XKbit, DLY XN<delay>X10 XW<time-unit>Xusec
  reliability 255/255, txload 1/255, rxload 1/255
  Encapsulation ARPA, medium is broadcast
  Port mode is trunk
  full-duplex, 10 Gb/s, media type is 10G
  Beacon is turned off
  Auto-Negotiation is turned on
  Input flow-control is off, output flow-control is off
  Auto-mdix is turned off
  Rate mode is dedicated
  Switchport monitor is off
  EtherType is 0x8100
  EEE (efficient-ethernet) : n/a
  Last link flapped 5week(s) 5day(s)
  Last clearing of "show interface" counters 00:13:57
  0 interface resets
  30 seconds input rate 48 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec
  30 seconds output rate 1720 bits/sec, 2 packets/sec
  Load-Interval #2: 5 minute (300 seconds)
    input rate 48 bps, 0 pps; output rate 1.70 Kbps, 2 pps
  RX
    5954 unicast packets  28 multicast packets  0 broadcast packets
    5982 input packets  32660602 bytes
    3900 jumbo packets  0 storm suppression packets
    0 runts  0 giants  0 CRC  0 no buffer
    0 input error  0 short frame  0 overrun   0 underrun  0 ignored
    0 watchdog  0 bad etype drop  0 bad proto drop  0 if down drop
    0 input with dribble  0 input discard
    0 Rx pause
  TX
    5980 unicast packets  2528 multicast packets  1 broadcast packets
    8509 output packets  32890534 bytes
    3900 jumbo packets
    0 output error  0 collision  0 deferred  0 late collision
    0 lost carrier  0 no carrier  0 babble  0 output discard
    0 Tx pause
